neurotools.functions module¶

neurotools.functions.log_factorial(k)[source]¶

Returns the logarithm of a factorial by taking the sum of the logarithms of 1..N. Slow, but numerically more accurate than taking the logarithm of the factorial or using approximations.

k should be an integer.

neurotools.functions.npdf(mu, sigma, x)[source]¶

Gaussian probability density

neurotools.functions.sigmoid(x)[source]¶

More numerically stable version of the logit function

neurotools.functions.slog(x, eps=1e-06)[source]¶

Natural logarithm that truncats inputs to small positive value epsilon (eps, default 1e-6) to avoid underflow in the output.

neurotools.functions.softhresh(x)[source]¶

Soft-threshold function (rescaled hyperbolic tangent)
